title: (x) Script similar to Tennessee on Jack Daniel's label - various {gang}
content:
Hi guys, I´m working on a Jack Daniels Article in a magazine, and I wonder if you can suggest me some similar font to use in the headlines and other subtitles in the article.  
I´m looking a font similar than the TENNESSEE word. I guess it must be a custom work, but maybe you know some font similar.

thanks very much in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115022819im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jack_3815.jpg)
author: mariano

comments.content:
Mousse Script might be an option:

[http://new.myfonts.com/search/mousse/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115022819/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/mousse/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/mousse/fonts/")

Harold Lohner's [Scarlet Ribbons](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115022819/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=HAFO-SCRI#) also has a similar feel, I think.

- Mike Yanega

I think Doyald Young Had a finger in the in that label. I recall I read something about it in one of his 3 masterpieces.

Cheers
[FF Jackie](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115022819/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_jackie/&sample_text=Tennessee) was inspired by the Tennessee bit on the Jack Daniel’s label.

thanks to all of you! it was very usefull your suggestions!  
regards

Mariano
